key_points: Tom Brady, quarterback for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has purchased a $6 million yacht following his Super Bowl win in February.
Brady became familiar with yachts after moving from the New England Patriots to Tampa Bay, which he described as a 'boating community'.
He previously owned a $2 million Wajer 55S yacht, which he brought to the Bucs' boat parade after their Super Bowl victory.
The new yacht, a Wajer 77, is considered an upgrade suitable for family vacations, especially for longer trips such as those to the Caribbean.
Brady stated the Wajer 77 will better accommodate day and weekend trips, particularly useful for his family's travels to the Bahamas.
He made $25 million from his base salary in 2020 alone, indicating the yacht purchase does not significantly impact his finances.
Brady's endorsements add substantial income to his already impressive salary.
The football from Brady's first pass in the NFL is being auctioned off by Lelands, offering fans a piece of football history.
Lelands' director of acquisitions Jordan Gilroy highlighted the rarity and potential future value increase of the football.
Gilroy also mentioned the possibility of the football going into a private collection, potentially making this auction its last public offering.
